p.span: K12itc is now providing technical support for students and parents at home. See this Flyer for more information.

div.script: $(document).ready(function() {CheckScript('ModuleView');CheckScript('Mustache'); });

p.span: The Fayette R-III School District is committed to providing support services to students during the extended closure of school due to the COVID 19 pandemic. Information on how the district plans to ensure children have meals at no cost to families, academic opportunities, health services, social/emotional support and technology assistance can be found in sections provided on this page.
We are serving grab and go meals for any child between the ages of 1 and 18.
Each bag includes lunch and breakfast.
This service began on March 18, 2020 and will continue as long as possible through COVID 19 school closure.
St. Joseph Catholic Church in Fayette 11:00-11:30
(A bus will be located in the parking lot behind the church.)
(A bus will be located on the street next to the community center.)

The District will continue to balance protecting public health and the health of our employees while continuing to provide service to our community. Our buildings and central office will be closed to the public, but as needs arise, please utilize email to communicate with staff. Administrators and administrative assistants will be monitoring voicemail left on building phone lines.

We recognize there are many challenges associated with the closure of our schools. Please know we are doing everything we can to help our families through this. Our intention is to sustain opportunities for students’ learning and to provide enrichment activities to keep students’ minds engaged. If your child needs something that was left at school, please contact the building or district office to get assistance. Parents who have questions or concerns about specific assignments are encouraged to email their child’s teacher and/or the building principal.

The Counseling Department has set up two phone lines. For the high school counselor, please call 660-616-0042. For the elementary/middle school counselor please call 660-596-6425. Supporting our staff, students and families socially and emotionally during this time is very important. If you or your child have questions that are not an emergency in nature, please email your child’s building counselor or call the numbers listed above for assistance.

br.span: Burrell Behavioral Health will be hosting a “Be Well Community” initiative on Facebook Live each day from 12:45 PM – 1:15 PM. During this time, anyone in the community can hop on for a general self-care check-in and engage in self-care activities.

p.span: The Missouri DHSS has created a COVID-19 hotline to provide guidance and answer questions from citizens and healthcare providers. The number is 877-435-8411. This number can be reached 24 hours a day, seven days a week and is being operated by medical professionals.

img.style: display: block; margin-left: auto; margin-right: auto;
img.title: Picture of teachers receiving a PLC award
img.alt: Picture of teachers receiving a PLC award

p.span: Daly Elementary School was recently designated as a National Model PLC School. Daly is now one of only 22 schools in Missouri and 237 schools in the nation to earn this designation. This recognition is presented to schools that follow the PLC practices and have shown evidence of creating and implementing a guaranteed and viable curriculum, monitoring student learning on a timely basis, creating and implementing systems of intervention and extension for students, and building high-performing, collaborative teams that focus their efforts on improved student learning. We are very proud of our dedicated staff and the work that they have done to establish a Professional Learning Community that operates at such high levels!

div.p: Fayette R-III School District • 705 Lucky Street Fayette, MO 65248 • Site Map
Fayette R-III School District • 705 Lucky Street Fayette, MO 65248 Site Map
Fayette R-III School District • 705 Lucky Street Fayette, MO 65248

div.div: It is the policy of the Fayette R-III School District not to discriminate on the basis of race, color, religion, gender, national origin, age, or disability in its programs or employment practices as required by Title VI and VII of the Civil Rights Act of 1964, Title IX of the Education Amendments of 1972, Section 504 of the Rehabilitation Act of 1973, the Age Discrimination Act of 1975 and Title II of the Americans with Disabilities Act of 1990. Inquiries or concerns regarding civil rights compliance should be directed to Mr. Brent Doolin, Title IX/non-discrimination coordinator at 704 Lucky Street, Fayette, MO 65248; telephone: 660-248-3800. Inquiries and complaints may also be directed to the Kansas City Office for Civil Rights, U.S. Department of Education, 8930 Ward Parkway, Suite 2037, Kansas City, MO 64114; telephone: 816-268-0550; FAX: 816-823-1404; TDD: 877-521-2172.
